alert.note: Alert for Eastern Montgomery; Lower Bucks (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 02 at 3:14PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Montgomery and central Bucks Counties through 345 PM EDT... At 314 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Chalfont, or 16 miles north of Philadelphia, moving southwest at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Lansdale, East Norriton, Doylestown, Hatboro, Ambler, Jenkintown, Chalfont, Abington, Willow Grove, Horsham, North Wales, New Britain, Fort Washington, Blue Bell, Maple Glen, Glenside, Spring House, Oreland, Montgomeryville and Wyncote. This includes the following highways... Pennsylvania Turnpike between mile markers 337 and 344. Northeast Extension between mile markers 23 and 26. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
